property.name: Keywords
property.value: Code Gate

property.name: Rules
property.value: The rez cost of IQ is increased by 1 for each card in HQ. IQ has +1 strength for each card in HQ. [Subroutine] End the run.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Created by merging the brainscans of over a hundred of the most intelligent people in Haas-Bioroid's cerebral database, its effectiveness is limited either by its lack of imagination or the imagination of the sysops who employ it.

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Click],[Click],[Click]: Rez a card, ignoring all costs.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Eliza's Toybox is the preeminent purveyor of high-class debauchery on the moon, courtesy of its bioroid pleasure models and other exotica. Every fantasy has its price.

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Subroutine] The Corp may choose a card in HQ. The Runner accesses that card. If he or she does, trash Kitsune.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: There are those who believe the nine-tailed fox is an angel in disguise. And then there are those who have followed, and discovered her secret…

property.name: Rules
property.value: The Runner cannot jack out while running on this server unless he or she trashes 1 installed program . Limit 1 region per server.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The port was first built as a remote location to unload and offload dangerous felons.

property.name: Rules
property.value: The Runner cannot play current events.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "There are reports of a terrorist threat at Starport Kaguya. The NAPD is offering a reward for anone who can provide them with information about the current whereabouts of the individual pictured here. He is considered extremely dangerous and is armed with a PAD and a portable rig."

property.name: Rules
property.value: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The first time the Runner makes a successful run each turn, trace2 - if successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Code Gate-Morph

property.name: Rules
property.value: Wendigo can be advanced. While Wendigo has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains barrier and loses code gate. [Subroutine] Choose a program. The Runner cannot use the chosen program for the remainder of the run.

property.name: Faction
property.value: The Weyland Consortium

property.name: Rules
property.value: Successful runs against this server are not considered to be successful or unsuccessful for the purposes of card abilities. Limit 1 region per server.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Mars would never have been colonized if not for the Gagarin facilities at Promontorium Agarum.

property.name: Faction
property.value: The Weyland Consortium

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you score Chronos Project, the Runner removes all cards in his or her heap from the game.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The irony is that those who'd want to destroy certain memories can't afford to do so, and those who can afford–well, they're too busy sipping on dreamwine.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Shattered Remains can be advanced. If you pay 1[Credits] when the Runner accesses Shattered Remains, trash 1 piece of hardware for each advancement token on Shattered Remains.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When the Runner encounters Lancelot, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Lancelot gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: He who wields the sword of valor.

property.name: Instructions
property.value: Reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ||⏎ Trash Targeted Program.

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Free Spirit

property.name: Rules
property.value: Once per turn, break 1 barrier subroutine.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Why should we be slaves to our genetic heritage?"

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1[Credits]: Break 1 barrier subroutine (or up to 3 subroutines if you spent a credit from a stealth card). 2[Credits]: +1 strength (or +2 strength if you spent at least 1 credit from a stealth card).

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Bad luck for any sysop blind enough to cross its path.

property.name: Instructions
property.value: 1 [Credits]: Break barrier subroutine.||1 [Credits]: Break up to three barrier subroutines (use only when planning to use stealth credits).||2 [Credits]: +1 strength.||2 [Credits]: +2 strength (Use only when planning to use stealth credits).

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Click],[Click],[Click],[Click]: Draw 10 cards.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Carved directly out of the lunar rock, Duggar's is a popular spot among blue-collar loonies and slumming risties. A place where you could find what you're looking for–if you knew who to look for, and didn't get distracted by the energetic dancers.

property.name: Rules
property.value: +2 [Memory Unit]. Your maximum hand size is increased by 2. Limit 1 console per player.

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Click]: Host a resource or piece of hardware from your grip on The Supplier. When your turn begins, you may install a hosted card, lowering the install cost by 2.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I can get you anything, and guarantee the best prices in ?."

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[Credits]: +3 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "If you look like you belong, people will ignore you for hours. Or years. It's only when you don't fit in that things start to go wrong." - Exile

property.name: Instructions
property.value: 1 [Credits]: Break code gate subroutine.||1 [Credits]: +3 strength. Must have credits on a stealth card.

property.name: Rules
property.value: The first time you have no credits in your credit pool each turn, gain 1[Credits].

property.name: Flavor
property.value: There have been several attempts to create a "world church", uniting all human faiths into a single, harmonious whole. The irony, of course, is that each new "world church" is another schism in humanity's shared religious experience.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, instead of accessing cards, you may install Hades Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs. [Trash]: Access all cards from Archives. Limit 1 per deck.

property.name: Rules
property.value: You have 1 additional [Click] to spend each turn. Trash Rachel Beckman if you are tagged.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "This is Rachel Beckman. She's in the business of keeping people alive." Rachel smiled. "Only when I'm not in the business of killing them."
